newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Belgian Uniwear eyes more acquisitions.
newsitem.headline: Belgian Uniwear eyes more acquisitions.

text.p: Belgian textile holdings company Uniwear SA said on Monday it was looking out for more acquisition targets in the textile and leather industries.
The company said earlier this month it was likely to announce an acquisition at Monday's results conference.

"Several (possible) acquisitions are being looked at at the same time," Uniwear managing director Andrea Cattaneo Della Volta told a news conference to present 1996 results. "We'd rather wait until we're sure (before signing a deal).
He said that since Uniwear's 288 million franc capital increase in March it would be easier to finance a buy, and that Uniwear was interested in targets with turnaround potential.
Uniwear aims to develop its flax division by acquisitions or collaboration with other companies active in the sector to boost market share and increase its range of products.
"A pick up (in the flax sector) is already visible. Prices should rise in the second half of the year," it added.

In its children's socks and stockings activities the group wanted to control production costs, reduce fixed costs and increase its market. "To this efect takeovers of other companies in the sector are envisaged," it added.
The leather division was winning market share, it noted.
Uniwear said its goal was also to increase its market capitalisation to 1.5 billion francs from 850 million currently to attract interest from institutional investors.

Group net profit rose to 30.5 million francs in 1996 from 5.7 million in 1995. U.K. hosiery manufacturer and distributor Pex plc, in which Uniwear bought a stake in January 1996, made net profit of 24.5 million francs after 116.1 million loss, with productivity boosted by new machines.
